title: Top Drugs Final Mock E — 88 Questions

easy.prompt: Which drug has this mechanism? Inhibits conversion of angiotensin I to angiotensin II, causing vasodilation and reduced aldosterone.

choices: Inhibits calcium influx into vascular smooth muscle causing arteriolar vasodilation
Competes with aldosterone in distal tubules
answer: Inhibits calcium influx into vascular smooth muscle causing arteriolar vasodilation

easy.prompt: Which drug has this mechanism? Inhibits HMG-CoA reductase, reducing cholesterol synthesis and increasing LDL uptake.

choices: Inhibits PCSK9 protein to prevent LDL receptor degradation (monoclonal antibody).
Inhibits cholesterol absorption at the brush border.
Activates PPAR-alpha to increase lipolysis of triglyceride-rich particles.
Inhibits lipolysis in adipose tissue and reduces hepatic VLDL synthesis.
answer: Inhibits PCSK9 protein to prevent LDL receptor degradation (monoclonal antibody).

easy.prompt: Which drug has this mechanism? Enhances antithrombin III activity to inhibit thrombin and Factor Xa.

choices: Directly inhibits Factor Xa, preventing conversion of prothrombin to thrombin
Inhibits synthesis of vitamin K–dependent clotting factors
Enhances antithrombin III with preferential Factor Xa inhibition
answer: Directly inhibits Factor Xa, preventing conversion of prothrombin to thrombin

easy.prompt: Which drug has this mechanism? Blocks sodium channels; decreases conduction in ischemic and depolarized cells.

choices: Nonselectively blocks beta receptors and inhibits potassium channels; prolongs action potential and refractory period
Inhibits potassium channels responsible for repolarization
Slows AV nodal conduction via increased parasympathetic tone
Blocks sodium channels in ischemic tissue
answer: Nonselectively blocks beta receptors and inhibits potassium channels; prolongs action potential and refractory period

easy.prompt: Which drug has this mechanism? Basal insulin regulating glucose metabolism.
Pick the mechanism for Insulin Lispro (Humalog).
choices: Bolus insulin that stimulates glucose uptake in muscle and fat and inhibits hepatic glucose production
Decreases hepatic glucose production and intestinal absorption of glucose
Inhibits SGLT2 in proximal renal tubules
answer: Bolus insulin that stimulates glucose uptake in muscle and fat and inhibits hepatic glucose production

easy.prompt: Which drug has this mechanism? Dual GIP/GLP-1 receptor agonist; enhances glucose-dependent insulin and reduces glucagon.

choices: Activates GLP-1 receptor; increases glucose-dependent insulin; decreases inappropriate glucagon; slows gastric emptying; lowers food intake
Increases insulin sensitivity by activating PPAR-gamma
Inhibits SGLT2 in proximal renal tubules
answer: Activates GLP-1 receptor; increases glucose-dependent insulin; decreases inappropriate glucagon; slows gastric emptying; lowers food intake

easy.prompt: Which drug has this mechanism? Stimulates pancreatic beta cells by blocking ATP-sensitive potassium channels to increase insulin release.

choices: Inhibits SGLT2 in the proximal renal tubules to reduce glucose reabsorption.
Increases insulin sensitivity by activating PPAR-gamma.
answer: Inhibits SGLT2 in the proximal renal tubules to reduce glucose reabsorption.

easy.prompt: Which drug has this mechanism? Stabilizes neuronal membranes by promoting sodium efflux or decreasing sodium influx in motor cortex neurons.

choices: Stabilizes neuronal membranes and modulates release of excitatory neurotransmitters
Enhances GABA via benzodiazepine receptor complex
Inhibits voltage-dependent N-type calcium channels; facilitates GABAergic inhibition
Blocks voltage-dependent sodium channels; enhances GABA(A); antagonizes AMPA/kainate; weak carbonic anhydrase inhibitor
answer: Stabilizes neuronal membranes and modulates release of excitatory neurotransmitters

easy.prompt: Which drug has this mechanism? Inhibits reuptake of norepinephrine and dopamine, increasing their levels.

choices: Increases dopamine release by blocking alpha-2-adrenergic and 5-HT2C receptors
Inhibits reuptake of serotonin and norepinephrine
answer: Increases dopamine release by blocking alpha-2-adrenergic and 5-HT2C receptors

easy.prompt: Which drug has this mechanism? Typical antipsychotic (course emphasis on class).

choices: Antagonizes dopamine D2 and serotonin 5-HT2 receptors, producing antipsychotic effects
Partial agonist at D2 and 5-HT1A; antagonist at 5-HT2A
Enhances GABA via benzodiazepine receptor complex
answer: Antagonizes dopamine D2 and serotonin 5-HT2 receptors, producing antipsychotic effects

easy.prompt: Which drug has this mechanism? Benzodiazepine; enhances GABA effects at the receptor complex.

choices: Largely unknown; high affinity for 5-HT1A and 5-HT2 receptors; does not affect benzodiazepine-GABA receptors
Benzodiazepine; enhances GABA effects at the receptor complex
Enhances GABA via non-benzodiazepine receptor complex
Inhibits SGLT2 in proximal renal tubules
answer: Largely unknown; high affinity for 5-HT1A and 5-HT2 receptors; does not affect benzodiazepine-GABA receptors
